summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, regarding the production of spreadsheets from FBI hard drives. The government is providing a sanitized version of spreadsheets that originally contained embedded photographs depicting child exploitation material, with the materials marked as subject to a protective order.

events.title: Production of Sanitized Spreadsheets
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a version of spreadsheets from FBI hard drives to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, with embedded photographs of child exploitation material removed.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential materials.

keyFacts: The FBI hard drives in the Ghislaine Maxwell case contained spreadsheets embedded with photographs depicting child exploitation materials.
The government produced a sanitized version of these spreadsheets to the defense, with the photographs removed, due to the nature of the content.
The production was governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the materials were marked with specific control numbers (SDNY GM 02765031 through SDNY GM 02765061).

The Department of Justice directed the office to cease using the word 'confidential' on materials to avoid confusion with classified document markings, leading to a specific labeling referencing protective order paragraphs.
This document confirms the existence of visual evidence (photographs) categorized as child exploitation material in the government's possession related to the Maxwell case.
